problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: A scientist places a plant cell in a hypertonic solution. What will happen to the cell?
options: The cell will plasmolyse (shrink and detach from cell wall) due to osmosis
The cell will swell but will not burst due to osmosis
The cell will bust due to osmosis
problems.hint: A hypertonic solution means that the solution has more solute than the plant cell, meaning that water will naturally flow from the cell out into the solution to create balance.
problems.detailed: The correct option is B. Due to osmosis, water will passively flow from areas of high to low concentration.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question:
Identify the following statements as true or false:
Plant cells are generally larger than animal cells
Plant cells have cilia and flagella
Only plant cells have centrosomes, which deal with microtubule organisation
Only plant cells have plasmodesmata
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option A. Plant cells are generally larger than animal cells. Plant cells Do NOT have cilia and flagella because they are immoble, and do not need to move. Plant cells DO NOt have centrosomes, animal cells do. Finally, it is true that only plant cells have plasmodesmata.
